title: [Large-Scale] Instructional Design-Based Development Process for Computer-Assisted Mathematical Language Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary mathematical terminology and fundamental digital device operation skills
context.additional_context: CALL system implementation for mathematics terminology and concept learning, with enhanced readability and color-based cognitive support in screen design

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain mathematical terminology and basic concepts in Korean.
Learners can describe step-by-step processes for solving math problems using a Computer-Assisted Language Learning (CALL) system.
Learners can understand learning content at over 80% accuracy by utilizing visual cues (color/layout) provided in digital learning environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
